page.title: 08Badlesmere : Religion
page.content: There are two churches in the area - both Anglican. St. Leonard at Badlesmere, on which site a church was noted in the lO85 Domesday Book and which today is notable for its box pews and double decker pulpit as well as its one bell brought from Reculver Church in l83O, and St. Laurence, Leaveland (a completely original l3th Century building). Together with the parish churches at Selling, Throwley and Sheldwich, these churches form the Benefice (created 25 June l985) of Selling with Throwley and Sheldwich with Badlesmere and Leaveland, the present incumbent being the Rector, the Reverend J.V.H. Russell. Both churches have small congregrations. Each church is run by its own Parochial Church Council.Non Anglicans are catered for in nearby towns.
